entries.title: Sunak Tells Health Leaders ‘Bold’ Approach Is Needed For NHS Fix
entries.description: UK Prime Minister Rishi Sunak told a gathering of health and social-care leaders that a “bold and radical approach” is needed to end the crisis at the country’s National Health Service.

entries.title: Top Chile Official Resigns as Opposition Pressures Boric
entries.description: One of Chile’s top officials has resigned as the government of left-wing President Gabriel Boric faces growing pressure over its decision to pardon protesters.

entries.title: New York and Chicago Mayors Tell Colorado to Stop Busing Migrants
entries.description: The mayors of New York City and Chicago denounced Colorado for busing migrants to the two cities — calling it inhumane and a strain on resources — as President Joe Biden’s first presidential visit to the US-Mexico border highlights immigration issues.

entries.title: McCarthy Starts Out With Agenda Already Hemmed In by Dissidents
entries.description: Newly elected House Speaker Kevin McCarthy sought to rally Republicans with pledges to champion federal spending cuts, strengthen border security and counter “woke indoctrination,” hinting at his dependence on a small group of populist conservatives over the next two years.

entries.title: Almost 9,000 NYC Nurses Prepare to Strike on Staffing Levels
entries.description: Another three New York City hospitals reached tentative contract agreements with unions overnight Friday, leaving about 8,700 nurses still prepared to strike on Monday to protest what they say are unsafe staffing levels.

entries.title: Seattle Schools Sue Big Tech Over Youth Mental Health Crisis
entries.description: The Seattle city school district filed a novel lawsuit blaming Big Tech for poisoning youth with social media addiction, saying the schools can’t fulfill their educational mission while students are suffering from anxiety, depression and other psychological troubles.

entries.title: Santos Sidesteps Lies Saying Congress Isn’t About Personal Life
entries.description: Representative George Santos, the New York Republican who has acknowledged inventing significant parts of his life story, said his work in Congress “is not about my personal life” and vowed “to start delivering results.”

entries.title: Age of Virginia Class Shooter Presents Rarity, Legal Hurdle
entries.description: Norfolk, Va. (AP) -- A school shooting that Virginia police said was committed by a 6-year-old student represents an extremely rare occurrence of a young child bringing a gun into school and wounding a teacher, according to experts who study gun violence.

entries.title: More Nations to Covid Test Chinese Travelers as Variant Spreads
entries.description: Countries from around the world are stepping up measures to shield their populations from the Covid-19 outbreak in China that comes as a more transmissible variant of the virus boosts infections globally.

entries.title: Biden’s Border Visit Will Showcase a City Strained by Migration
entries.description: Joe Biden’s choice of El Paso, Texas, as the site of his first presidential visit to the US-Mexico border puts a spotlight on a city that has struggled to deal with a four-fold surge in the number of migrants on its streets.

entries.title: Ketanji Brown Jackson Book Deal Joins Trendy Supreme Court Side Hustle
entries.description: Ketanji Brown Jackson’s new book deal adds to what has become a phenomenon at the US Supreme Court: Justices looking to craft their own images and perhaps score a hefty payday along the way.

entries.title: Erdogan Hints Turkey’s Election Could Come Earlier Than Scheduled
entries.description: President Recep Tayyip Erdogan hinted on Saturday that Turkey’s upcoming elections could be held in May, a month earlier than scheduled.

entries.title: Turmoil in the US House, China’s Covid Crisis: Weekend Reads
entries.description: Two years after supporters of Donald Trump stormed the US Capitol, the House was gripped by turmoil again as a protracted deadlock between establishment Republicans and hard-line conservatives to elect a new speaker took the most ballots to resolve since 1859.

entries.title: Somalia Claims Al-Shabab Extremists Seek Talks for 1st Time
entries.description: Mogadishu, Somalia (AP) -- Somalia’s government claimed Saturday that the al-Shabab extremist group has for the first time asked to open negotiations, amid a military offensive the government has described as “total war.”

entries.title: Harry Calls Role as Best Man at William’s Wedding ‘a Bare-Faced Lie’
entries.description: Prince William (centre) and his best man Prince Harry (left) are greeted by Receiver General Stephen Lamport (right) as they arrive inside Westminster Abbey, London, where Prince William and Kate Middleton will marry later today. (Photo by Anthony Devlin/PA Images via Getty Images)

entries.title: Iran’s Supreme Leader Replaces Police Chief After Protests
entries.description: Iran’s Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei appointed a new police commander, telling him to ensure public security after deadly protests swept the country.

entries.title: Thailand Brings Back Covid Entry Rules as China’s Borders Reopen
entries.description: Thailand will reintroduce Covid-19 entry requirements for foreigners flying into the country from Monday, the nation’s transport minister said, as the Southeast Asian nation prepares for an expected wave of tourists from China.

entries.title: Portugal to Require Covid Tests for Passengers on Flights From China
entries.description: Portugal is the latest European country to require passengers on flights from China to present a negative Covid test before boarding the airplane.

entries.title: South Africa Has Its First Case of Most Transmissible Covid Variant
entries.description: South Africa has found its first case of a coronavirus infection caused by the new, highly transmissible XBB.1.5 variant.

entries.title: Ukraine Latest: Russian Cease-Fire Moves Into Second Day
entries.description: The unilateral cease-fire called by Russian President Vladimir Putin to coincide with the Orthodox Christmas holiday is scheduled to run through Saturday. Kyiv dismissed the offer as a ploy. At least limited fighting continued in eastern Ukraine on Friday. Putin attended a church service in Moscow on Friday night.

entries.title: UK Train Stoppages Continue as Threat Grows of Broader Strikes
entries.description: UK travelers face another day of nationwide train strikes, with union leaders seeking to coordinate wider work stoppages across the public sector amid a row over pay.

entries.title: China to Monitor Travelers at Borders for New Covid-19 Variant
entries.description: China will monitor travelers into the country at some border-crossings for infections of a new Covid-19 variant, and will allow local governments to reimpose mobility curbs on residents to prevent outbreaks after the country reopens its borders Sunday.

entries.title: Racism Has Become Part of Everyday Life for Minorities in Sweden
entries.description: The Nordic country’s reputation as a liberal haven is in tatters as the Sweden Democrat party wins over more voters and racism flourishes

entries.title: Iran Executes Two More Prisoners Over Anti-Regime Protests
entries.description: Iranian authorities hanged two men on Saturday for allegedly killing a member of the security forces during anti-regime protests, the judiciary’s official Mizan news agency reported.

entries.title: ‘Crisis and Confusion’: Four Days of GOP Barbs, Chaos and Cigars
entries.description: Kevin McCarthy’s torturous bid for House speaker leads to shattered records and abandoned norms.

entries.title: Labour to Tempt Retirees With Right to Work From Home
entries.description: Labour is hoping to tempt early retirees back to the work force with the right to work from home.

entries.title: Key Points From Prince Harry’s Tell-All Book
entries.description: With excerpts from the Duke of Sussex's tell-all book leaked ahead of its publication, here are the claims and revelations so far.

entries.title: McCarthy Overcomes GOP Rebellion to Be Elected House Speaker
entries.description: Republican Kevin McCarthy achieved his long-held ambition of becoming House speaker early Saturday after quelling a rebellion by GOP conservative hardliners, but at the cost of further weakening his precarious position within a sharply divided party.

entries.title: McCarthy Blocked Again in Stunning Loss on 14th Speaker Vote
entries.description: Republican Kevin McCarthy suffered a stunning and humiliating loss in the 14th round of balloting for speaker, just hours after he and his allies had put together a compromise they expected would win over his opponents.

entries.title: McCarthy Vote Stalls in Extraordinary Tumult on House Floor
entries.description: The bitter fight among Republicans to select a House speaker escalated to shoving and shouting on chamber’s floor as GOP leader Kevin McCarthy angrily confronted one of his most vocal and strident critics, Florida’s Matt Gaetz.

entries.title: China Reports 854 New Severe Covid Cases, Three Deaths on Friday
entries.description: China had 5,870 severe Covid-19 infections as of Friday, up 854 from a day earlier, according to data from the Chinese Center for Disease Control and Prevention.

entries.title: US Cuts Taiwan Transits Even as China Steps Up Military Pressure
entries.description: The US reduced its number of naval transits through the Taiwan Strait in 2022 to the lowest level in four years even as China stepped up military pressure on the island it vows to one day control.

entries.title: Train Firms ‘Have Made Millions in Profits Since Being Put on New Contracts’
entries.description: Train companies at the heart of the long-running rail dispute have made hundreds of millions of pounds in profits since the Government put them on new contracts when the Covid-19 pandemic hit, a union claims.
